base_data.markdown_content:
Summary : This is a black-and-white logo featuring a stylized depiction of a Sri Lankan heraldic lion holding a sword, encircled by ornate patterns and flanked by symbolic elements, commonly associated with official government emblems. logo: Sri Lankan government emblem Main Elements : • Central circular motif contains a heraldic lion holding a sword, facing left. • Surrounding the lion is a ring with stylized leaf or flame patterns. • At the top, a wheel-like symbol (Dharmachakra) is present. • At the base, a pedestal or vase-like element is flanked by two smaller circular symbols. • The entire design is enclosed within a double circular border. Design Details : • Black-and-white line art, no colour. • Symmetrical composition, with the lion as the focal point. • Ornamental flourishes and traditional motifs throughout. Dimensions & Placement : • Vertical orientation, with the Dharmachakra at the top and pedestal at the bottom. • Proportions suggest a tall, narrow emblem suitable for official documents or signage. Analysis : • The logo uses traditional Sri Lankan iconography to convey authority and national identity. • The presence of the lion and Dharmachakra signals cultural and historical significance. • The symmetrical and ornate design reinforces its use as a formal government symbol. ශ්‍රී ලංකා ප්‍රජාතාන්ත්‍රික සමාජවාදී ජනරජයේ ගැසට් පත්‍රය අති විශේෂ The Gazette of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka EXTRAORDINARY අංක 2289/43 - 2022 ජූලි මස 22 වැනි සිකුරාදා - 2022.07.22 No. 2289/43 - FRIDAY, JULY 22, 2022 (Published by Authority) PART I : SECTION (I) — GENERAL Government Notifications THE CONSTITUTION OF THE DEMOCRATIC SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF SRI LANKA ## Notifications WHEREAS I have in the exercise of powers vested in me in terms of sub-paragraph (a) of Paragraph (1) of Article 44 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, determined the number of Ministers of the Cabinet of Ministers and the Ministries and the assignment of subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions to the said Ministers; It is now hereby notified that the subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions in the charge of various Ministers shall be as set out in the schedule given below, from the date of this Notification. All such subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions that are not specifically assigned to any Minister will continue to remain in my charge as the President. RANIL WICKREMESINGHE, President. chunks.text:
Summary : This is a black-and-white logo featuring a stylized depiction of a Sri Lankan heraldic lion holding a sword, encircled by ornate patterns and flanked by symbolic elements, commonly associated with official government emblems.

logo: Sri Lankan government emblem

Main Elements :
  • Central circular motif contains a heraldic lion holding a sword, facing left.
  • Surrounding the lion is a ring with stylized leaf or flame patterns.
  • At the top, a wheel-like symbol (Dharmachakra) is present.
  • At the base, a pedestal or vase-like element is flanked by two smaller circular symbols.
  • The entire design is enclosed within a double circular border.

Design Details :
  • Black-and-white line art, no colour.
  • Symmetrical composition, with the lion as the focal point.
  • Ornamental flourishes and traditional motifs throughout.

Dimensions & Placement :
  • Vertical orientation, with the Dharmachakra at the top and pedestal at the bottom.
  • Proportions suggest a tall, narrow emblem suitable for official documents or signage.

Analysis :
  • The logo uses traditional Sri Lankan iconography to convey authority and national identity.
  • The presence of the lion and Dharmachakra signals cultural and historical significance.
  • The symmetrical and ornate design reinforces its use as a formal government symbol.

ශ්‍රී ලංකා ප්‍රජාතාන්ත්‍රික සමාජවාදී ජනරජයේ ගැසට් පත්‍රය

අති විශේෂ

The Gazette of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka

EXTRAORDINARY
(Published by Authority)
PART I : SECTION (I) — GENERAL
Government Notifications
THE CONSTITUTION OF THE DEMOCRATIC SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF SRI LANKA

## Notifications

WHEREAS I have in the exercise of powers vested in me in terms of sub-paragraph (a) of Paragraph (1) of Article 44 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, determined the number of Ministers of the Cabinet of Ministers and the Ministries and the assignment of subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions to the said Ministers;

It is now hereby notified that the subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions in the charge of various Ministers shall be as set out in the schedule given below, from the date of this Notification.

All such subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions that are not specifically assigned to any Minister will continue to remain in my charge as the President.

RANIL WICKREMESINGHE,  
President.

Presidential Secretariat  
Colombo 01  
July 22, 2022

Summary : This image is a QR code, a type of two-dimensional barcode, consisting of black and white square modules arranged in a square grid. It is designed to encode data that can be read by QR code scanners or smartphone cameras.

barcode:  
Type & Structure :  
  • QR code (Quick Response code), standard square format.  
  • Contains three large position markers (squares) at the top-left, top-right, and bottom-left corners.  
  • The remaining area is filled with smaller black and white modules encoding the data.  
  • Approximate module count: 25 × 25.  
  • Quiet zone (white border) present around the code.

Data Content :  
  • Encoded data is not visually readable; requires a QR code scanner to extract.  
  • No visible alphanumeric string or human-readable text.

Design Encodings :  
  • Black modules on a white background.  
  • No visible logo, image, or colour other than black and white.

Analysis :  
  • The QR code is formatted for standard digital scanning and likely encodes a URL, text, or other data.  
  • No additional visual elements or branding are present; the code is generic and functional.

amendment_data.markdown_content:
Summary : This is a black-and-white emblem featuring a central image of an elephant carrying a casket, surrounded by concentric decorative rings and additional symbolic elements, commonly associated with Sri Lankan government or official institutions.

logo:  
Main Elements : 
  • Central image: An elephant facing left, carrying a casket on its back.
  • Surrounding the elephant: A circular band with stylized decorative motifs.
  • Top: A Dharmachakra (wheel of Dharma) symbol.
  • Bottom: Two smaller circular emblems flanking a pedestal or altar-like base.
  • All elements are enclosed within a larger circular frame with ornate detailing.

Dimensions & Placement : 
  • The logo is vertically oriented, with the Dharmachakra at the topmost point and the base at the bottom.
  • The elephant and casket are centrally placed within the innermost circle.

Analysis : 
  • The use of the elephant and casket is symbolic of cultural and religious heritage, likely referencing the Esala Perahera or similar traditions.
  • The Dharmachakra and other motifs suggest Buddhist influence and official or ceremonial significance. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.437,t=0.098,r=0.554,b=0.208), with ID c08a6ce4-ca1f-45eb-8327-1073ac8dd021 -->

## Notification

IT is hereby notified that the notification issued by me in the exercise of powers vested in me under paragraph (1) (a) of Article 44 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and published in the _Gazette Extraordinary_ No. 2289/43 of July 22, 2022, as amended by _Gazette Extraordinary_ No. 2297/78 of September 16, 2022 is further amended with effect from October 06, 2022 in the manner set out in the schedule below. <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.074,t=0.526,r=0.918,b=0.617), with ID 25c89400-1069-4e6e-87d5-8fb06b2f0406 -->

Summary : This image is a QR code, a type of two-dimensional barcode, consisting of black and white square modules arranged in a square grid.

barcode:  
Type & Structure :  
  • QR code (Quick Response code) format.  
  • Square grid with three large position markers in the top-left, top-right, and bottom-left corners.  
  • Module count: approximately 25 × 25 modules.  
  • Quiet zone (white border) present on all sides.

Content :  
  • Encoded data is not visually readable; no visible numeric or alphanumeric string.  
  • No embedded logo, text, or image within the code.

Design Details :  
  • Black modules on a white background.  
  • Standard QR code layout with finder patterns and alignment patterns.

Analysis :  
  • The QR code is designed for digital scanning and likely encodes a URL, text, or other data, but the exact content cannot be determined from the image alone.  
  • The presence of standard position markers and quiet zone indicates it is suitable for reliable scanning by QR code readers. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.795,t=0.790,r=0.872,b=0.843), with ID 2183850e-c00b-4ec5-b812-1dd69f1825d0 -->

chunks.text:
Summary : This is a black-and-white emblem featuring a central image of an elephant carrying a casket, surrounded by concentric decorative rings and additional symbolic elements, commonly associated with Sri Lankan government or official institutions.

logo:  
Main Elements : 
  • Central image: An elephant facing left, carrying a casket on its back.
  • Surrounding the elephant: A circular band with stylized decorative motifs.
  • Top: A Dharmachakra (wheel of Dharma) symbol.
  • Bottom: Two smaller circular emblems flanking a pedestal or altar-like base.
  • All elements are enclosed within a larger circular frame with ornate detailing.

Dimensions & Placement : 
  • The logo is vertically oriented, with the Dharmachakra at the topmost point and the base at the bottom.
  • The elephant and casket are centrally placed within the innermost circle.

Analysis : 
  • The use of the elephant and casket is symbolic of cultural and religious heritage, likely referencing the Esala Perahera or similar traditions.
  • The Dharmachakra and other motifs suggest Buddhist influence and official or ceremonial significance.

ශ්‍රී ලංකා ප්‍රජාතාන්ත්‍රික සමාජවාදී ජනරජයේ ගැසට් පත්‍රය
අති විශේෂ
The Gazette of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
EXTRAORDINARY
(Published by Authority)

PART I : SECTION (I) — GENERAL  
Government Notifications
THE  CONSTITUTION  OF  THE  DEMOCRATIC  SOCIALIST  REPUBLIC  OF  SRI  LANKA

## Notification

IT is hereby notified that the notification issued by me in the exercise of powers vested in me under paragraph (1) (a) of Article 44 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and published in the _Gazette Extraordinary_ No. 2289/43 of July 22, 2022, as amended by _Gazette Extraordinary_ No. 2297/78 of September 16, 2022 is further amended with effect from October 06, 2022 in the manner set out in the schedule below.

RANIL WICKREMESINGHE,  
President.

Presidential Secretariat,
Colombo 01,
05th October, 2022.

Summary : This image is a QR code, a type of two-dimensional barcode, consisting of black and white square modules arranged in a square grid.

barcode:  
Type & Structure :  
  • QR code (Quick Response code) format.  
  • Square grid with three large position markers in the top-left, top-right, and bottom-left corners.  
  • Module count: approximately 25 × 25 modules.  
  • Quiet zone (white border) present on all sides.

Content :  
  • Encoded data is not visually readable; no visible numeric or alphanumeric string.  
  • No embedded logo, text, or image within the code.

Design Details :  
  • Black modules on a white background.  
  • Standard QR code layout with finder patterns and alignment patterns.

Analysis :  
  • The QR code is designed for digital scanning and likely encodes a URL, text, or other data, but the exact content cannot be determined from the image alone.  
  • The presence of standard position markers and quiet zone indicates it is suitable for reliable scanning by QR code readers.

1A- G 37695 - 366 (10/2022)
